Without this entry if you start Repair install and Recovery Console from USB, they will NOT see the XP installation on the hard disk.  
It is NOT to be executed/selected and the error you see is normal.   
If it bothers you during startup, simply decrease timeout value to 1 or 2 in boot.ini on your hard drive.

forumNotes.author: ilko
forumNotes.content:
To repair from USB stick you need to boot from USB stick ( makes sense, doesn't it :wink: ), start normal Setup until you get offered Repair, leaving the line about USB repair intact in the boot.ini on the internal hard disk.  
You do NOT start "repair from USB" booting from internal hard disk and selecting USB repair option. To repeat- this option is NOT to be selected by user, it is used only by XP setup as pointer where Windows installation is, when another Setup routine (including RC and Repair install) is launched from USB.
